item.title: NYC and San Francisco Reopen Theaters at 25% Capacity
item.description: New York and California are the film industry's two biggest American marketsWith theaters in both states closed for nearly a year, Hollywood mostly paused blockbuster releases. Theaters are capped at 25% capacity. Zoom out: The struggling cinema industry is getting some hopeful plot twists. is disregarding time to re-release it following a disappointing September debut.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Why Jack Dorsey’s Fintech Square Bought Tidal
item.description: He bought that stake back as part of the Square acquisition.  First, the backstory: Tidal, which was bought by rapper Jay-Z (and a few other artists) in 2015, aimed to compete with Spotify and Apple Music by offering exclusive music and videos.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Nasdaq Turns Negative, 10-Year Rises as Fed Sticks to Status Quo
item.description: In an interview with the WSJ, Powell said that while he expects some inflation ahead, he doesn't think it'll last and the Fed will keep interest rates near zero. Inflation worries have sent bond yields—still low by historic standards—spiking, making investors worry that the Fed will raise interest rates to put a brake on the economy and keep inflation in check.   That sounded reassuring, but investors are still feeling nervous about inflation and the Fed potentally hiking rates. Yesterday, they turned to Fed Chair Jerome Powell for a reassuring hug.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Nasdaq Turns Negative, 10-Year Rises as Fed Sticks to Status Quo
item.description: In an interview with the WSJ, Powell said that while he expects some inflation ahead, he doesn't think it'll last and the Fed will keep interest rates near zero. Inflation worries have sent bond yields—still low by historic standards—spiking upwards, making investors worry that the Fed will raise interest rates to put a brake on the economy and keep inflation in check.   That sounded reassuring, but investors are still feeling nervous about inflation and the Fed potentally hiking rates: They continued to drop stocks and bonds, sending yields higher. Yesterday, they turned to Fed Chair Jerome Powell for a reassuring hug.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: NYC and San Francisco Reopen Theaters at 25% Capacity
item.description: New York and California are the film industry's two biggest American marketsWith theaters in both regions closed for nearly a year, Hollywood mostly paused blockbuster releases. Theaters are capped at 25% capacity. doesn't everyone sneak in candy to movie theaters anyway? Zoom out: The struggling cinema industry is getting some hopeful plot twists.

item.title: Energy Biz Focuses Attention on Carbon Capture
item.description: In the energy biz, attention is turning toward an expensive but enticing way to reduce emissions: carbon capture, a process where pollution is... Exxon Mobil has, up until now, resisted carbon capture, but it's recently come under pressure by an activist investor to reduce its CO2 output.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Texas Lifts Restrictions: What It Means for Businesses
item.description: Many health experts argue the moves could lead to a resurgence of the virus, and some business owners say they’re worried because the statewide mask mandate gave them cover when dealing with mask-resistant customers.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Google Commits to Phasing Out Invasive Third-Party Cookies
item.description: That way, businesses can still serve targeted ads, but your specific user data is a little more private since Google is essentially hiding it in a crowd. To a certain extent, the modern advertising businesses of internet giants like Google and Facebook are built on the buttery backs of cookies. Currently, using cookies, Google can see that a user was shopping for a new golf bag on Amazon, then later serve them a Callaway ad next to a Golf.  Now, through a program called “Privacy Sandbox,” Google is testing a way for companies to target ads to groups of users with similar interests instead of directly to individuals.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Energy Biz Focuses Attention on Carbon Capture
item.description: In the energy biz, attention is turning toward an expensive but enticing way to reduce emissions: carbon capture, a process where pollution is... ExxonMobil has, up until now, resisted carbon capture, but it has recently been put under pressure by an activist investor to reduce its CO2 output.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Google Commits to Phasing Out Invasive Third-Party Cookies
item.description: That way, businesses can still serve targeted ads, but your specific user data is a little more private since Google is essentially hiding it in a crowd. To a certain extent, the modern advertising businesses of internet giants like Google and Facebook are built on the buttery backs of cookies. Google confirmed yesterday that it plans to phase out the practice of letting companies track users across the web using cookies by next year.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Texas Lifts Restrictions: What It Means for Businesses
item.description: Retailers including gym operator Life Time Fitness, grocer Albertsons, and some local restaurants have dropped mask requirements, plan to return to normal capacity, or both.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: New Media Company TOGETHXR Aims to Tell Stories of Female Athletes
item.description: To combat that asymmetry, TOGETHXR will produce original content and partner closely with social media platforms, serving an audience of girls and young women.    The war chest: TOGETHXR nabbed a "mid-seven figure investment" from Magnet Companies, a private equity holding company run by longtime media mavens, per the NYT.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Explainer: What Are 10-Year Treasury Notes and Yields?
item.description: Or ask us another question here.  As demand for the 10-year 📈, the yield 📉. Investors are often willing to accept lower yields because they know their investment is safe. This week, yields have stabilized. Yields were very low during most of the pandemic. Alas, today's hottest bond is the 10-year Treasury note, which the government issues to borrow money (the 10 means it matures in 10 years.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: March 3
item.description: (The Generalist)  Read: A deeeeeeep dive into the history of Reddit and why it may be undervalued. The retailer will invest $4 billion annually in the next few years to keep up its pandemic-era momentum. combined.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Microsoft Unveils Mesh, a Mixed Reality Platform
item.description: Microsoft thinks Mesh can help push adoption forward."   Mixed reality combines the real and digital, letting users interact with both. There's work to do before those holograms make George Lucas proud, but yesterday, Microsoft introduced its vision for our mixed reality future: Mesh. Zoom out: Tech giants have spent years developing augmented, virtual, and mixed reality tech.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Covid Vaccine: Rivals Merck and Johnson & Johnson to Join Forces on Production
item.description: J&J's vaccine is expected to be limited in the next couple of weeks, but with Merck's help, J&J will ship 20 million doses by the end of March. In the most surprising pharma partnership since Walter White and Gus Fring, Merck and rival Johnson & Johnson will work together to scale up production of J&J's single-dose vaccine, the Biden administration said yesterday.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: March 3
item.description: (The Generalist)  Read: A deeeeeeep dive into the history of Reddit and why it may be undervalued. The retailer will invest $4 billion annually in the next few years to keep up its pandemic-era momentum. combined.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Covid Vaccine: Rivals Merck and Johnson & Johnson to Join Forces on Production
item.description: In the most surprising pharma partnership since Walter White and Gus Fring, Merck and rival Johnson & Johnson will work together to scale up production of J&J's single-dose vaccine, the Biden administration said yesterday.   The backstory: The FDA authorized J&J's vaccine for emergency use over the weekend, and the company is on track to deliver 100 million vaccines by the end of June.  Merck did try to enter the Covid-19 vaccine race, but it got a late start and folded the effort in January after clinical studies for its vaccine flopped.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: New Media Company TOGETHXR Aims to Tell Stories of Female Athletes
item.description: To combat that asymmetry, TOGETHXR will produce original content and partner closely with social media platforms, serving an audience of girls and young women.    The war chest: TOGETHXR nabbed a "mid-seven figure investment" from Magnet Companies, a private equity holding company run by longtime media mavens, per the NYT.

item.title: Microsoft Unveils Mesh, a Mixed Reality Platform
item.description: But Microsoft thinks Mesh can help push adoption forward."   Mixed reality combines the real and digital, letting users interact with both. There's work to do before those holograms make George Lucas proud, but yesterday, Microsoft introduced its vision for our mixed reality future: Mesh.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: March 2
item.description: (Nautilus)  Read: If aliens exist, here's how we'll find them.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Sen. Warren Unveils Wealth Tax Proposal
item.description: Last week, Treasury Sec. Janet Yellen said a wealth tax has been discussed, but given "very difficult implementation problems," the Biden administration would rather look into increased corporate or capital gains taxes.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: SPACs Start 2021 on a Torrid Pace
item.description: The latest SPAC deal is Rocket Lab, a leader in launching small satellites into space.  Quick refresher: A SPAC is a shell company that goes public, raises money, then uses those funds to acquire a private company and, in doing so, take them public. (NYT)
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Senate Prepares for Stimulus Vote
item.description: It's a win for centristsLike their House colleagues, Senate Republicans will likely unanimously oppose the bill. Now that the wage increase is out, a handful of moderate Democrats who were skeptical of it are more likely to support the bill. If it passes, the House will need to vote again on a matching version.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Buy-Now-Pay-Later Giant Klarna Worth $31B After Latest Round of Funding
item.description: Why the BNPL hype? Companies like Macy's and Neiman Marcus still rely heavily on store- and co-branded credit card fees to pad their bottom lines, offerings that compete with BNPL options.  One of the earliest companies to the BNPL game, Klarna offers consumers the option to pay for an item online in installments rather than all at once.  But BNPL has put retail giants in a pickle.  That concerns regulators, since more than than 10% of customers at one bank that had used BNPL were already behind on their payments, according to the UK's Financial Conduct Authority.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: SPACs Start 2021 on a Torrid Pace
item.description: The latest SPAC deal is Rocket Lab, a leader in launching small satellites into space.  Quick refresher: A SPAC is a shell company that goes public, raises money, then uses those funds to acquire a private company and, in doing so, take them public. (NYT)

item.title: Buy-Now-Pay-Later Giant Klarna Worth $31 Billion After Latest Round of Funding
item.description: Companies like Macy's and Neiman Marcus still rely heavily on store- and co-branded credit card fees to pad their bottom lines, offerings that compete with BNPL options. Why the BNPL hype?  But BNPL has put retail giants in a pickle.  That concerns regulators, since more than than 10% of customers at one bank that had used BNPL were already behind on their payments, according to the UK's Financial Conduct Authority. Last October, Macy's agreed to take a stake in Klarna in exchange for offering its BNPL service as an option at checkout.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Sen. Warren Unveils Wealth Tax Proposal
item.description: While many politicians agree the ultra-wealthy should pay more, some disagree about whether wealth taxes are the way to go.  Wealth taxes are distinct from the income taxes you're probably filing right now.  Bottom line: The bill isn't expected to pass, even with Democratic control of Congress and the White House.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Senate Prepares for Stimulus Vote
item.description: Now that the wage increase is out, a handful of moderate Democrats who were skeptical of it are more likely to support the bill. If it passes, the House will need to vote again on a matching version.  As soon as Wednesday, the Senate will vote.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: How Much Do You Know About Tax Forms? Take This 6-Question Quiz to Find Out
item.description: What is a Schedule SE (self-employment tax) form not used for: Net earnings on self employment Your benefits under social security The amount you owe in state taxes Answers: 1) a 2) c 3) e 4) false 5) b 6) c A Schedule F is a profit and loss form for: Finance Industry Professionals Farmers Fishermen Fathers Foundations 6. True or false: Only sole proprietors need to complete an individual income tax return.
item.author: Devin Tomb
